snippet.description:
I filmed a VLOG?!?  My son and I decided to film a Day In The Life Vlog on Christmas break!  I'll warn you...it might not be the most thrilling video you've ever seen but it's a peek into our lives on a regular day!  Running errands, working, randomness and unboxing my new MacBook Air for your guys!  P.S. I'm not very techy so don't laugh 🤣

I know this isn't my normal type of video but I wanted to try something new for you guys...let me know if you enjoy these types of videos...if so, I'll try to add one in here and there (and I'll try to pick a more exciting day lol).  Thanks for watching, I appreciate YOU!

snippet.description:
Calculating our net worth for the first time!  I have never taken the time to sit down and calculate our net worth...finally did this and thought it would be a good video to film!  Do you know your net worth?  Let me know!  I think it's a great idea to track your net worth and a good metric to help keep you motivated by watching your progress!  I plan to track my net worth on a quarterly basis!

Thank you for watching...please subscribe and join my YT family ♡

snippet.description:
This is the fifth and final video in my Begin to Budget series!  In this series, you will learn exactly what a budget is all about and why you (yes, you) need a budget!  I will walk you every step of the way to make sure you understand exactly how a zero-based monthly budget works and help you create a budget you can actually stick to!

snippet.description:
Breaking down our February budget and sharing our real numbers and budget spreadsheet.  We do have a variable income so our income numbers are estimates.  

We follow Dave Ramsey's zero-based budget giving every dollar a job and sending any extra money to our emergency fund savings.

A quick note - when editing, I realized I forgot to add in the last payment for my daughter's trip that I mentioned in the beginning...the cost is an additional $48 in the first half of the month!  I hope this video helps you in your own budgeting process!

snippet.title: February 2020 Budget With Real Numbers / Come Budget With Me

snippet.description:
Explaining Dave Ramsey's 7 Baby Steps...It has been 3 years since my husband and I took Financial Peace University, a money management course created by Dave Ramsey that changed our entire lives!  The Baby steps system gave us the tools to change our finances, get out of debt and save money and it has been a total game-changer! 

If you've never heard of the Baby Steps system before you can read the book The Total Money Makeover (linked below) - it's a great read and almost like a Financial Peace University (FPU) course in a book!

This system helped us pay off $54,500 of debt in under 20 months and got us started on a course to financial freedom.  It is a great place to start if your finances are a mess...

Today I'm giving you a brief explanation of each baby step so you can understand if this system would be a good fit for you!

Baby Step 1 - Save a starter emergency fund
Baby Step 2 - Pay off all non-mortgage debt
Baby Step 3 - Save 3-6 months of living expenses
Baby Step 4 - Save 15% of your income for retirement
Baby Step 5 - Save for kids' college
Baby Step 6 - Pay off mortgage
Baby Step 7 - Build wealth and give

#DaveRamsey #babystepssystem #financialpeace

♡ Thank you for watching...please subscribe and join my YT family ♡

snippet.description:
Finally getting up the VLOG I promised!  I asked you on YT if you would be interested in seeing a Day in the Life VLOG from me and there was a lot of interest so I starting filming right away but I'm embarrassed to say it took me over a month to get it edited and uploaded 🤦🏼‍♀️(I'm the worst)...

I can say that I actually enjoyed the process of vlogging but I need a lot of practice lol...It was way more work than I anticipated but I appreciate you all so much for watching and supporting my channel and I want to try and make the content you want to see...if you liked this type of video from me please let me know and I will try to create more vlogs! 

⭐️Get up to a $20 shopping credit when you try Thrive Market - http://bit.ly/337Ateq ⭐️

Here's the marinade recipe I promised.  I just dump everything in a Tupperware, add the chicken and put it in the fridge for a few hours...I don't measure, sorry!
-balsamic vinegar
-brown sugar
-lemon juice
-minced garlic
-dijon mustard
-olive oil
-salt + pepper
-onion powder
-garlic powder

snippet.description:
Today I wanted do my April 2020 monthly budget to review how to create a bare bones budget when budgeting during a financial crisis.  I know many of you are struggling right now with loss of income or a job and I wanted to show you the first steps of adjusting your budget to reduce spending, save for an emergency fund and stretch your money as far as possible.

With all the craziness in the world right now with Corona and quarantine, I want to show you how we are scaling back in our monthly budget and spending during these times of economic uncertainty.  

I did mess up and forget to include an extra 2 weeks of cash envelopes (which I explain toward the end) I hope it's not confusing.  Please let me know if you. have questions!

Please leave a comment letting me know how you are doing!

Sending you all prayers and love...Please stay healthy and stay home!! (even though it's hard) 💕

 #stayhomewithme #barebonesbudget #emergencybudget

snippet.title: How To Create An Emergency Budget

snippet.description:
Hi all 👋🏻I hope you're hanging in there and doing okay, mentally and physically!  I have an unplanned video for you because a $2 Trillion Stimulus Package was passed and I wanted to share my thoughts on how you can responsibly spend the 2020 Stimulus check you may be receiving shortly! 

💰This article will give you lots of detailed information on what's included in the stimulus package and whether or not you qualify to receive a check --
https://www.nytimes.com/article/coronavirus-stimulus-package-questions-answers.html

💰My hope is that you can use this money to strengthen your current financial situation so we will discuss the options of saving the money in an emergency fund, stashing it in your sinking funds, investing, stimulating the economy, paying essential bills, paying off debt and putting it towards other financial goals.

💰I also share how much we will be personally receiving and how we plan to spend the money.

💰How to adjust your budget in a crisis - https://youtu.be/NNZPP0wOqg4

Please leave a comment letting me know how you are doing!

snippet.title: Changing Things Up!  Come Budget With Me - May 2020 Budget

snippet.description:
Let's talk easy frugal meals!  Today we are making my family's absolute favorite meal...not only is it easy to make but it's a frugal meal too!  This is the first video in a series of videos I will be doing in the near future geared towards my fellow busy mommas!  I know how hard you work to save money and take care of your family and I want to share some of my best tips for surviving mom life!  

I'm not a chef and I'm definitely no mother-of-the-year but I AM a mom who loves her family and wants to take care of them the best she can BUT ALSO is short on time and doesn't want to grab takeout or spend a ton of money on dinner so my specialty is quick and frugal!  So come along and cook with me today!  Let me know if you like videos like these so I know whether or not I should make more!

Thanks for being here...I appreciate you spending some time with me today!

Come say Hi 👋🏻 in the comments...I love chatting with you!

‣ Compensation was received for my honest opinion.  

#blackfridayshopping #savemoney #frugalhacks

------------------
